info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 2:52PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL MORA COUNTY THROUGH 330 PM MDT... At 252 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ocate, or 15 miles northeast of Mora, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Rainsville and Ojo Feliz. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.
